node.html: During my summer internship at Amazon's Alexa Widget Gallery team, I significantly improved their testing and monitoring processes. I developed a command-line interface tool using Kotlin, which automated Alexa device simulations, enhancing test automation capabilities by 70%. Additionally, I revamped the system monitoring and issue resolution efficiency by 60% through implementing comprehensive log analysis with Log4j. This experience honed my skills in automation and system optimization in a cutting-edge tech environment.

At Bracebridge, as a key member of the Data Acquisition Team, I focused on enhancing and streamlining the data pipeline to support the trading floor's needs. My significant contributions included automating SQL script generation and creating a centralized system using .Net (Blazor), which resulted in an 80% reduction in manual task management and a substantial boost in team productivity. Furthermore, I significantly optimized data acquisition pipelines by implementing advanced multi-threading and parallel processing techniques in C#, effectively doubling the processing speeds. These efforts played a crucial role in making data more accessible and insightful for trading operations.

At Schneider Electric, within the Digital Transformation initiative, I streamlined data security processes by automating access management using AWS, which significantly reduced manual labor hours annually. I developed a modular UI framework in Typescript, cutting down website development time by 30%, and enhanced data security by converting an Excel-based tool into a web application with PHP, significantly reducing security vulnerabilities. My role also involved mentoring graduate trainees, fostering their technical and professional growth.
